text: Suzanne Venker (born in St. Louis, Missouri), is an American non-fiction author and radio host at KXFN. She has authored several anti-feminist books. She was disinvited from a speaking engagement at Williams College in 2015. She co-wrote The Flipside of Feminism: What Conservative Women Know – and Men Can't Say with her late aunt, the conservative lawyer and activist Phyllis Schlafly. ==Selected works== * :*Review: * * * * * ==References== ==External links== * Official website. __FORCETOC__ Category:American non-fiction writers Category:Boston University alumni Category:Female critics of feminism Category:Living people Category:Men's rights activists Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Suzanne Venker
